head.title: Schedule of Bond Offerings This Week

hedline.hl1: Schedule of Bond Offerings This Week

block.p: The Treasury's schedule of financings this week is confined to today's regular weekly auction of three- and six-month bills and a 37-day cash-management bill.
By the close of the New York cash market on Friday, traders said, the rate on the outstanding three-month bill was 6.09 percent; a six-month bill was 6.04 percent.
The Treasury's schedule of financings this week is confined to today's regular weekly auction of three- and six-month bills and a 37-day cash-management bill.
By the close of the New York cash market on Friday, traders said, the rate on the outstanding three-month bill was 6.09 percent; a six-month bill was 6.04 percent.
The following taxable and tax-exempt fixed-income issues are scheduled for pricing this week:
TAXABLE ONE DAY DURING THE WEEK
Dow Chemical Colo., $300 million of 5-year notes, A1/A/---. Bear, Stearns & Co., and WR Hambrecht.
HCA-The Healthcare Co., $500 million of senior unsecured notes, Ba2/BB+/---. Chase Bank Hambrecht & Quist and Goldman, Sachs & Co. (Source: MCM CorporateWatch)
Ratings: Moody's Investors Service/Standard & Poor's Corp./Duff & Phelps Credit.
TAX EXEMPT
MONDAY Sedgwick County, Kan., $94.5 million of general obligation bonds. Competitive.
TUESDAY Arapahoe County Building Finance, Colo., $57.2 million of certificate of participation. Competitive.
Tantasqua, Mass., $51.3 million of general obligation bonds. Competitive.
WEDNESDAY Worcester, Mass., $58.1 million of general obligation bonds. Competitive.
TAX EXEMPT
ONE DAY DURING THE WEEK
Adventist Health System/Sunbelt Obligated Group, $116.5 million of hospital revenue bonds.
B. C. Ziegler & Co.
City & County of San Francisco, $150 million of certificates of participation for San Bruno Jail.
Lehman Brothers.
City of Phoenix Civic Improvement Corp., $65 million of municipal facilities subordinated excise tax revenue bonds. Siebert Brandford Shank & Co.
Illinois, $300 million of general oligation bonds.
Lehman Brothers.
Maricopa County, Ariz., El Paso Electric Co., $195 million of debt securities. Salomon Smith Barney.
Massachusetts Housing Finance Authority, $50 million of single family bonds. Paine Webber Inc.
New York State Thruway Authority, $358.2 million of local highway & bridge service contract bonds. J.P. Morgan Securities.
New Jersey Health Care, $132.5 million of debt securities for Robert Wood Johnson. Paine Webber Inc.
Pharr-San Juan-Alamo Independent School District, $58 million of Texas Unlimited tax school building bonds. Dain Rauscher Inc.
Puerto Rico Electric Power Authority, $550 million of debt securities. Bear, Stearns & Co.
